intro: Kibatalia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved kibatalia, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature common in many members of the family. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
